AgriConnectNow is a ServiceNow-powered digital sustainability and supply-chain platform that connects farmers, cooperatives, logistics providers, and buyers on one unified ecosystem.

It uses automation, AI insights, and sustainability metrics to enhance the traceability, transparency, and profitability of farm product management — from production to delivery
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement:
Across many developing economies farmers face persistent challenges such as:
Lack of visibility into market demand and fair pricing.
Post-harvest losses due to poor logistics coordination.
Limited transparency in farm-to-market product traceability.
Weak data management systems for sustainability tracking (carbon footprint, water usage, soil health).
These inefficiencies lead to food waste, reduced farmer income, and environmental impact

How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

App Engine Studio

Build a centralized Farm Product Lifecycle Portal where farmers and aggregators can record crop yields, input usage, and harvest data.

IntegrationHub

Connects with IoT-based sensors and agricultural APIs (weather, soil data, crop health) for real-time monitoring.

Flow Designer

Automates workflows such as farm inspections, certification requests, logistics scheduling, and payment approvals.

Service Catalog & Procurement Module

Allows cooperatives or government agencies to manage digital purchase orders, supply requests, and vendor payments (integrated with existing ERP).

Performance Analytics & ESG Dashboards

Visualizes sustainability metrics like carbon emissions, fertilizer usage, water efficiency, and yield per hectare — supporting SDG-aligned reporting.

Knowledge Management

Hosts agricultural best practices, sustainability training modules, and government policy updates to educate farmers.

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  1. IoT devices or APIs for farm data collection (soil, weather, moisture sensors).
  2. Integration with national ERP or payment systems for supply chain and treasury automation.
  3. ServiceNow App Engine, Flow Designer, IntegrationHub, Performance Analytics, and GRC modules.
  4. Mobile-friendly interface for rural access (low-data mode)

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  1. Limited internet access or tech literacy in rural communities.
  2. Ensuring accurate IoT data calibration and maintenance.
  3. High initial cost of sensor deployment.
  4. Need for strong data governance and privacy controls.
  5. Alignment with national agricultural and trade policies.
